formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Definition For integers \(a\) and \(n > 1\), the value of \(a \bmod n\) is the unique integer \(r\) such that \(0 \le r \le n-1\) and \[ a = qn + r \quad \text{for some integer } q. \] Two integers \(a\) and \(b\) are congruent modulo \(n\) if they have the same remainder: \[ a \equiv b \pmod n \quad \Longleftrightarrow \quad n \mid (a-b). \]
